Description: Fragment of shoulder of East Greek (North Ionian) black-figured pottery amphora. Inside reserved. Outside slipped white; glazed band at turn of neck, debased tongue frieze at top of shoulder. Pendant lotus and bud frieze in black-figure on shoulder
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Hamilton College, Clinton (NY). This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.016)
